sermons.title: (1 John #29) Praying the Dead to Life
(Daniel) The Prayer of a Prevailing Prophet
(Daniel) Twenty One Days of Prayer
sermons.description: Willie Mullan preaches expositionally through the first part of the tenth chapter of Daniel. He exhorts and uses many examples and scriptures towards praying, true praying. "Some of us have not been at it yet" (in reference to true praying). The devil fights most strongly against us when we pray. What a need to understand the schemes of the devil and principalities and powers that we fight against.

sermons.title: (Easter Convention 2008) Prayer in the New Testament - Part 1
(Easter Convention 2008) Prayer in the New Testament - Part 2
(Easter Convention 2008) Prayer in the New Testament - Part 3
(Easter Convention 2008) Prayer in the Old Testament - Part 1
(Easter Convention 2008) Prayer in the Old Testament - Part 2
(Luke) 32 - Prayer-Father & Friend
sermons.description: The parable of the friend at midnight and the father on prayer are not comparisons but contrasts.  God is not a sleepy, old grouch but an infinitely better Friend who never says, "Don't bother Me."  The message of these parables isn't persevering in prayer but rather having a boldness, confidence and assurance to pour out your heart to your Friend and Father any time day or night!

sermons.title: (Mt Pleasant) 5. Prayer in the Old Testament - Part 1
(Mt Pleasant) 6. Prayer in the Old Testament - Part 2
(Mt Pleasant) 7. Prayer in the New Testament - Part 1
(Mt Pleasant) 8. Prayer in the New Testament - Part 2
(Mt Pleasant) 9. Prayer in the New Testament - Part 3
(South West Baptist Church 2008) Old Testament Prayer
(South West Baptist Church 2008) Task Oriented Prayer
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 1
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 10
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 11
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 12
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 13
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 2
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 3
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 4
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 5
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 6
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 7
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 8
(The Sermon on the Mount and Prayer - Session 1) - Part 9
2006 Heart-Cry - Prayer
sermons.description: Paul talks about Jesus Christ and how he prayed. He had thousands of sick people waiting to be healed, but what did Jesus do? He prayed. He could have said, I have so much work to do I have no time to pray...Paul Washer points out that we should pray BECAUSE we have so much work to do and if we don't pray we'll never get it done.

sermons.title: 3 Truths, 3 Enemies & 4 Ways God Answers Prayer
6 Prayers For Our Children and Grandchildren
7 Things Prayer will do for the Church
A Call To Prayer
sermons.description: As the title suggests Michael Brown gives an earnest call to prayer which inspires zeal and identifies godly character with a life of prayer. There is a needed renewed call for prayer in our day.

sermons.title: A Call to Prayer: An Urgent Plea to Enter Into the Secret Place 1 of 2
sermons.description: Ryle notes that 'a habit of prayer is one of the surest marks of a true Christian.' Here we have a challenging spiritual stimulant for all Christians not to lay down this major weapon of our warfare.

sermons.title: A Call to Prayer: An Urgent Plea to Enter Into the Secret Place 2 of 2
sermons.description: Ryle notes that 'a habit of prayer is one of the surest marks of a true Christian.' Here we have a challenging spiritual stimulant for all Christians not to lay down this major weapon of our warfare.

sermons.title: A Life Changing Prayer
sermons.description: Dr. Stanley examines Paul's prayer found in Colossians 1:9-14. He says that is exactly the prayer that he wants someone to pray for him, and the prayer that you and I should pray for each other. He adds that the most powerful thing that anyone can do for anyone else "on the face of this earth is to pray for them."

sermons.title: A Prayer for Just Two Things
sermons.description: At a recent Brooklyn Tabernacle prayer meeting, Pastor Cymbala used Psalm 51 as the text for this short teaching.

sermons.title: A Prayer from Hell
sermons.description: A simple, passionate gospel message on this sobering text of the Rich man and Lazarus. It speaks of our eternal destination and abode either in heaven or hell. What a sobering reality that there is prayer in hell.

sermons.title: Calling On The Name Of The Lord
sermons.description: His clear cut call to really understanding the true nature of Christian life is that it must be lived in prayer. He shows from the beginning of the bible to the end God has gathered apart a people to Himself that would 'call upon His name'. Be challanged, convicted and changed as you listen to this message, it has been a turning point for my life and many others also that I personally know. I believe this message was preached at Jack Hayford's church. The quality isn't the best and the second half of the sermon is missing but its worth the listen.

sermons.title: Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 1
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 2
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 3
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 4
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 5
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 6
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 7
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 8
Collection Of A.W. Tozer's Prayers - Volume 9
Collection Of William P. Nicholson's Prayers - Volume 1
Facing The Face That We Seek
sermons.description: When we seek God's face in prayer, we need to ask ourselves: Are we really serious about the Almighty God revealing Himself to us in His Son, Jesus Christ -- in all His power, authority and glory -- in a way that can bring true spiritual awakening? Is this really what we want? Do we really dare to "face the face" of Him whom we seek? David Bryant gave this message at a national gathering of prayer leaders in 2002, and it's just as fresh and pertinent now as it was then. It is not so much a message about prayer, as it is a message about the ANSWER to all our prayers, Jesus Christ Himself...

sermons.title: First Baptist Atlanta in 1991 on Prayer - Part 4
Give yourself to prayer, and God will give Himself to you
Help Me to Start Talking - Prayer
Helpers In Prayer
sermons.description: Prayer can often become one of the most selfish things we do. In the light of scriptures, this messages examines the prayer life, and what it is to be. Communion with the Lord leads to spiritual growth, but intercession for the lost is often neglected. We need a burden for the lost and dying world around us.

sermons.title: How Not to Be a Mule
How To Pray In The Holy Spirit
How to Become a Person of Prayer
If My People will Pray
sermons.description: Preached at the South Lawrence Mennonite Church Revival 2011.

sermons.title: In Everything By Prayer
sermons.description: This is a lively sermon preached by Tozer on the importance of doing all that we do accompanied by prayer. He contrasts this with what the world accompanies their doings with: ex. money, influence, committees... Tozer is really preaching out of his heart in this sermon, calling the Church back to the simplicity of prayer and trust in God's sufficiency.

sermons.title: In The Shadow Of The Cross - Jesus Prays for Himself
In The Shadow Of The Cross - Jesus Prays for His First Followers
In nothing be anxious; but in everything by prayer
On the Journey of Prayer - Part 1
sermons.description: Many helpful books have been written on the subject of prayer in response to the question, â€œHow should I pray?â€  However, we need look no further than Godâ€™s Word for the most insightful and helpful direction. The Lord Jesus provides the answer to that question in His great Sermon on the Mount!  Dr. K.P. Yohannan today encourages us to get on the journey of prayer!

sermons.title: On the Journey of Prayer - Part 2
Our Father
sermons.description: He taught us to pray, "our Father" and not "my Father". When you become a child of God you cannot say, "I serve Him in my own way - you do your thing and I'll do mine". Such a person is on the wrong track. When we are born again we become part of God's spiritual family. When Jesus' mother and brothers wanted to speak to Him while He was preaching, He replied "who is my mother, and who are my brethren?". Then He pointed to His disciples and said, "whosoever will do the will of My Father in heaven, the same is my brother and sister and mother". The spiritual family is much more important than the physical blood family. If your child is not in the will of God, you are far apart from him, while another child who serves God, even not your blood-family, is much closer to you.

sermons.title: Power of Prayer
sermons.description: The biggest crisis in the average church today is lack of knowing the living God. Not many know God because they donâ€™t spend time in prayer getting to know Him, and actually listening for His voice. We will never know Him or His ways until we get away from all the noise and seek Him. â€œThe most significant thing in life is to seek God and know Him.â€ â€“K.P. Yohannan.

sermons.title: Prayer
sermons.description: An earnest and true exhortation to pray. Full of reality and grace.

sermons.title: Prayer
sermons.description: Charles Anderson points out the swiftness of petition and the power of prayer from the life of Daniel.  'The fastest thing in the universe,' he says, 'is not light but prayer.'  Here is the crux of the whole message: 'While there are still more than two billion souls going to hell without Jesus Christ who've never heard the gospel message on our planet, our prayer life ought to be totally transformed from the little stuff we are petitioning God for to a battering ram against the forces of hell.'

sermons.title: Prayer
sermons.description: Manley Beasley speaks on the place of intercession in the life of the believer.  The battles are won and lost in prayer, but Beasley laments how few people he can find to really intercede.  He teaches how a wrong view of sovereignty can negate an effectual life of prayer and how a right view can touch eternity.

sermons.title: Prayer - Founded On The Law And The Gospel
Prayer And Revival
sermons.description: Brother Evan shares his heart on the subject of revival and prayer. This challenging compilation calls for surrender and obedience to the call of God in Scriptures.

sermons.title: Prayer as a Way of Walking in Love: A Personal Journey
Preeminence of Prayer in the Life of Jesus
Righteous Prayer In An Unrighteous Time
Sealing The Stone And Setting The Guard
sermons.description: We are living in a time when society is attempting to put away the testimony of Jesus Christ and seal Him up so that their sinful behavior will not be challenged. We are reminded that God sits in Heaven above all power and authority. He can never be pushed out of anywhere because He is everywhere. God will raise up an army of people who are shut away in the secret place of prayer and empower us to be evidence that Jesus Christ is alive.

sermons.title: Self-Righteous Prayers (prayer call testimony)
sermons.description: Brother Edgar Reich shares some convicting personal testimonies and stories of the Lord's dealing in his heart recently. He shares a prophetic word from the Lord over self-righteous praying and also shared some stories of how the Lord spoke to him about his pride. Listen to this powerful testimony and challenge.

sermons.title: Song of Solomon Prayer as Communion
The Aroma of Prayer
sermons.description: Jim Cymbala passionately appeals to the example of Jesus and the church in the Book of Acts as a pattern for prayer in the Church.  In a day when more people are turning to crack than to Christ, he warns that real revival must have a praying people.  When the church today is being inundated with technicians, specialists and methodologies, the answer is not in these but in the power of the Holy Spirit through believing petition.  Cymbala closes by testifying to the God who answers prayer, sharing a very personal account of his wayward daughter brought back to the Lord in a glorious way.

sermons.title: The City
sermons.description: Pastor Cymbala refers to two polls that reflect the fact that secularism is gaining influence over the church in America. It's our prayer that revival will come to New York City and spread across the country. Matt 9:35-38 (GNB)

sermons.title: The Incredible Scope of Prayer
sermons.description: We have a face-to-face audience with God. What are you believing him for? Colossians 1:3-4;2:1;4:12

sermons.title: The Mightiest Prayer in the Bible
The Mightiest Weapon God can have at His Disposal
The Prayer Life of Our Lord
The Prayer Of A Drowning Runaway
The Prayer That Prepares the Way
The Role of a Prayer Burden
The Spiritual Discipline of Prayer and The Manner of a Disciple's Prayer
sermons.description: Jesus taught His disciples how to pray with a prayer we often call Â“The LordÂ’s Prayer.Â” But this prayer really should be called Â“the DisciplesÂ’ PrayerÂ” because Jesus never prayed it Himself. He said this is how we should pray. Jesus tells us to pray in a place where we can shut the door and be alone, where there is no one to impress but God.

sermons.title: The Supremacy of God in Prayer
The Violent Take It by Force
Things You Should't Pray About
sermons.description: Paris Reidhead gives a message about how to defeat our sin. Through seeking the things that are above, remembering the truth of what Christ has done for us and our death with Him on the cross, we can embrace the victory Christ has won. We don't need to pray about victory over sin as Christ has already provided it, we have only to accept it.

sermons.title: Thoughts on Prayer # 1 Love The Lord
sermons.description: These are a series of short messages by Pierre Chiasson on prayer given before daily prayer meetings at a week of special services at West Toronto Baptist Church. Pierre is ministering at Margaree Valley Baptist Church In Cape Breton Nova Scotia.

sermons.title: Thoughts on Prayer # 2  God's Willingness
sermons.description: These are a series of short messages by Pierre Chiasson on prayer given before daily prayer meetings at a week of special services at West Toronto Baptist Church. Pierre is ministering at Margaree Valley Baptist Church In Cape Breton Nova Scotia.

sermons.title: Thoughts on Prayer # 3  One thing I have desired
sermons.description: These are a series of short messages by Pierre Chiasson on prayer given before daily prayer meetings at a week of special services at West Toronto Baptist Church. Pierre is ministering at Margaree Valley Baptist Church In Cape Breton Nova Scotia.

sermons.title: Thoughts on Prayer # 4 Praying with others
sermons.description: These are a series of short messages by Pierre Chiasson on prayer given before daily prayer meetings at a week of special services at West Toronto Baptist Church. Pierre is ministering at Margaree Valley Baptist Church In Cape Breton Nova Scotia.

sermons.title: Thoughts on Prayer # 5 Prevailing Prayer
sermons.description: These are a series of short messages by Pierre Chiasson on prayer given before daily prayer meetings at a week of special services at West Toronto Baptist Church. Pierre is ministering at Margaree Valley Baptist Church In Cape Breton Nova Scotia.

sermons.title: Thoughts on Prayer # 6  Abiding with Christ
sermons.description: These are a series of short messages by Pierre Chiasson on prayer given before daily prayer meetings at a week of special services at West Toronto Baptist Church. Pierre is ministering at Margaree Valley Baptist Church In Cape Breton Nova Scotia.

sermons.title: We Will Give Ourselves To Prayer
When Lions Have Nothing More to Say
sermons.description: October 19, 2008 - It's time to stand in prayer, unmoved by the roar of Satan's lies. The devil only needs one area of sin in our heart to take us down. We can shut the mouth of the lions when we don’t allow past betrayals, injustice, jealousy and anger keep us from moving forward in Christ. We must get to the point where the devil has nothing more to say to us concerning these areas of pain. We know we are of an excellent spirit when we can bless the hand that God has used to hammer out our character on the anvil. We must understand that we don't grow by having our battles go away. We grow by having our battles finish their intended purposes.

sermons.title: When Prayer Touches Glory
sermons.description: There is a real spiritual battle when a Christian tries to pray. Even the disciples asked Jesus to teach them how to pray. As they listened to the Lord pray to his Father, something stirred them about how Jesus prayed, the intimacy Jesus had with the Father  was apparent to them as they listened to his prayer, prompting them to ask him to teach them to pray. Praying the scriptures adds power to prayer. This is a wonderful instruction on how to pray, for anyone who's become discouraged with their prayer life, this is a must hear.

sermons.title: When Supplies Run Low
sermons.description: In this message, Pastor Cymbala provides guidance to practical every day / every need praying. John 2: 1-11

sermons.title: When The Only Prayers You Have Left Are Tears
Why Pride Before Prayer? (Where God Begins in Reviving His People)
Your Prayer Can Change the World - Part 1
Your Prayer Can Change the World - Part 2
